name: Shove off
description:
Shoot approaching enemies as they attempt to drive you off screen using your miserably slow ship but nifty laser beam.

Left/Right = Turn Ship

Up = Move

Space = Shoot

This was produced for a Stencyl tutorial series - Find below the source files, commented code and sprites. Let me know how you get on and feel free to comment below if you have any problems whilst building it.

Feel free to download the source files at the bottom of the page and hope you find the tutorial useful!

HANDY HINT - SPEED THE VIDEO UP TO x1.25!

Intro - Building a Space Shooter in Stencylworks.

Part 1 - Importing your visuals into Stencylworks/Setting up Actors.

Part 2 - Setting up your scene and importing your assets.

Part 3 - Explaining each of the elements in the scene tab.

Part 4 - Introduction to the events interface + Start of player movement.

Part 5 - Continuing to add player movement/animations.

Part 6a - Getting the player ship to shoot bullets.

Part 6b - Getting the bullets to fly in the direction of the ship

Part 7 - Enemy Collision and Particle effects.

Part 8 - Scene Events (Killing the Player/Reloading Level).

Part 9a - Enemy Movement.

Part 9b - Enemy Movement (Continued)

Part 10 - Enemy Spawning and Displaying Text on Screen.

Part 11 - Creating sound, importing audio to Stencyl and exporting your game.
